channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report X-2024040599
item.description:
Report X-2024040599

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Discovered during a routine damaged hazmat check. Package was isolated in a red hazmat tote and transported to the damaged hazmat area. DescribePack: Both bottles had loose caps, and no seals on the bottles present. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated in a red hazmat tote and transported to the damaged hazmat area.

item.title: Report X-2024040471
item.description:
Report X-2024040471

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package wet at top of box. 1 plastic bottle leaking fluid from broken lid. Around 12 fl oz of contents lost. Bottle unable to be resealed. DescribePack: Broken screw-on cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package removed from loaded vehicle
